Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Lagniappe1971
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom, two bath suite for our party of 5 (two children). For the space and amenities (we used the fridge and microwave constantly), it was well worth the price. Considering that we received four dinners and five breakfasts, all you can eat, with free beer and wine at dinner, this was a great value. Even with small kids, it was not too far to get to the French Quarter in 20 minutes or to hop onto one of the streetcars. Keith, the sales manager, and his staff took extra care to make sure we were happy. And around us were many other families (besides the business people this hotel is intended for) that had figured out the same thing. We would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the New Orleans Homewood Suites are AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle E
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a weekend at the Homewood Suites in New Orleans and was extremely impressed with the level of customer service provided by the staff. Upon arriving to the hotel a bit early, the front desk people were very accomodating and provided an early check-in. Even though it was a really busy weekend, they took the extra time to be welcoming and answered all our questions. The manager even greeted us upon check-in and made sure we knew to contact her if we needed any assistance during our stay. The night staff people were just as friendly, always smiling as we walked past the desk and willing to provide a wealth of local information. Our suite was incredibly clean and so comfortable (it felt like being at home!). Even the pull-out couch/bed was super comfy to sleep on. We were most impressed by all the little extra things the staff did to make our stay enjoyable, like champagne with strawberries in the lobby (nice!) and complimentary bags of popcorn in our room. And finally, the free hot breakfast offered at this hotel was incredible...there was something that everyone in our group thouroughly enjoyed. We cant wait to visit New Orleans again and stay at the Homewood Suites...thank you for really making us feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Final Four Organization”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach02
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at this Homewood for the Final Four. I must say the atmosphere was crazy with fans everywhere, but the hotel staff was very organized, efficient, and helpful! Amid the craziness, check in was easy and efficient and they disseminated needed information. Good breakfast every morning and a fairly hearty pre-game dinner on Monday which included beer and wine! Rooms were clean and well appointed (I'm picky). Beds very comfortable. Location was great for our trip.....about half way between Quarter and the Stadium. Easy walk to Bourbon St and to the Stadium. Only two negatives, which I think were just overlooked, considering the attention given elsewhere: our room wasn't cleaned on Sunday (We were out late, but they gladly delivered clean towels) and the stopper in one of the bathroom sinks didn't work, so we pulled it out---it wasn't hooked up. We didn't report it, thinking housekeeping would, so our fault we didn't report it. We were in the room so little after I realized that housekeeping wouldn't report it, I didn't take the time. I would gladly return to this hotel. Just a qualification to my scores....value was rated low because of exorbitant rates charged for Final Four weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Final Four Fab”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgirl68
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Final Four and this hotel was perfect. Great central location, walking distance to Dome and Quarter. Staff was outstanding! Shout out to Johnny front desk, Lisa housekeeping, Charles at the door! Only negative was due to last minute trip, had to take smoking room and this floor could use an uplift. We would certainly stay there again and highly recommend it for good value and convenience. again, loved the staff and their Louisiana hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTripPlanner66
Reviews.Content: Our family only spent one night at the hotel but we plan to come back. The staff was wonderful. Kevin at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty. Not only did he give us the best advice on where to find the best gumbo in the French quarters, he highlighted a map of us and told us to spend about $3 and ride the trolley for a cheap tour. During breakfast, I notice the managers were help clearing tables. The notice our 7 and 9 year old boys getting restless and brought over coloring sheets and crayons. Also the rooms are spacious and the beds so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JeffTPD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Mardi Gras. This was a good central location for viewing parades and walking to the French Quarter. The Riverwalk was also walking distances. The Superdome is just down the street. Might stay here for the Super Bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Sharon C
Reviews.Content: We had family and friends stay here while in town for a wedding. We received many wonderful comments about how much they enjoyed their stay at the Homewood Suites. They loved the spaciousness of the rooms, the manager's reception during the week, breakfast in the morning, having the exercise room to work out in and how polite and helpful the staff was to their needs. Some are already planning return trips to the City and plan to stay again at the Homewood Suites. Thank you so much for taking care of our guests.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Glenn T
Reviews.Content: Keith and his staff went above and beyond our expectations. We arrived a little early and they offered to keep the bags until the rooms were ready, so we could go get lunch. When we came back, there was a little delay in getting the rooms, so they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine and bent over backwards to accomodate us. I would recommend this hotel to any of my family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: TimekiaF
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family for spring break, and the service was outstanding. The staff was very professional and assisted me quickly with all of my questions and concerns about the best way for me to travel around town on a walker. The hotel was very clean and well kept. The breakfast and managers reception was hot and delicious, the manager gave out coloring sheets to the children during breakfast. We will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JanWaldorf_MD
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Very clean rooms, great breakfast. Rooms were very clean. However the staff could have been a little more friendly. Jasmine was the only one at the front desk that was very friendly. Hotel is convenient to trolley cars and within waling distance to the French Quarter and the Riverfront.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend bachelor party”
Reviews.Author: Mattaci13
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed here for a NOLA bachelor party. Rooms were nice. Location was nice. The breakfast was good. For the cost, I would have thought the rooms would have been a little nicer (they were very plain). This is probably a great business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms great, staff seemed depressed”
Reviews.Author: Lauri101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for business beginning Ash Wednesday. It could be the staff was exhausted after a busy Mardi Gras season, but they seemed lackluster and unenthusiastic. Other than the check-in person Wednesday afternoon, no one was downright rude. The room was very clean and in fairly good condition except the plumbing fixtures could use some updating. Toilet seat was loose (I tightened it - but I shouldn't have had to!) and the water faucets were leaking. Sink didn't drain well. I was on 9th floor and heard no street noise. Kitchenette well furnished. Breakfast was outstanding! Excellent spread, plentiful and at correct temperature. Light supper also great and good to have menu listed in room so no surprises. Again - employees were not very outgoing and seemed unhappy. (Maybe they need a raise or some time off?) Internet free and speed ok. Coffee pot worked but only one coffee package. All other appliances functional. Toiletries great - all Nutrogena stuff, as is usual with Homewood. It was odd that there were no employees (bellman, etc) to assit with luggage or cabs. Door very hard to open and NOT ADA compliant. Taxis difficult to find - finally went across street to other hotel and tipped their bellman to get cab. Again - could have been the post Mardi Gras slump hitting the whole city. I'd stay at and recommend Homewood Suites again. Location good for work and fair for meals. Rouse grocery store 2 blocks away and well stocked with ready-to-eat and other foodstuff at decent prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2bcontinued
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the BCS National Championship Game so the room was EXTREMELY overpriced (as was to be expected) & required a 4-night stay in order to obtain a reservation. This is a nice hotel that's in a good location relative to the Superdome. (It's just a few blocks down Poydras Street, so we were able to walk to the Dome & back...no worries about where to park or the additional cost of Dome parking). Parking at the hotel is not included in the room cost, so that's an additional charge if you are using a car. The hotel's parking lot is toward the back & side of the hotel & is well-lit with security doing periodic checks. It is possible for the attendant to have you double or triple park, depending upon how full the hotel is, which then requires you to leave a key in order for your vehicle to be moved, if necessary. The hotel staff were very nice, both at check-in & check-out, as well as any other times we had interaction with them during our stay. The suite was nice, though it needed some minor cleaning throughout...which is the case at a lot of hotels, so I'm always sure to bring my own Lysol & antibacterial wipes. Having a kitchen area with apartment-sized refrigerator, microwave, 2 stovetop burners, dishwasher, utensils & dishes was a plus since we were there for 5 days. Bring your own (or purchase upon arrival) dishwashing liquid, as well as extra paper towels & dishwasher detergent if you will be staying several days. The bedroom area is separated with a door from the living/kitchen area, which is great if one person is wanting to sleep & someone else wants to watch tv, eat, read, etc. There are 2 televisions - one in the bedroom & one in the living area. We were there during a very busy time; thus, there could be quite a bit of street noise at times. We took the advice of some other reviewers & requested a higher floor, which seemed to help. (I always bring a small fan, too when traveling to help drown out any possible outside noises...be it in the hall or out on the street). Bed was comfortable. Closet was spacious. (It's located in the vanity area). Vanity area is spacious, too, but only one sink. The sink/vanity area is separated by a door from the shower/toliet room. But, the sink/vanity area opens into the bedroom. (No door to close it off, which could be a problem if one person has to be up early & others don't...the light or running water may be a problem). Mother's Restaurant is several blocks down on Poydras & has great "classic Cajun-style dishes". Yum! We had a car with us, but found it easiest to walk everywhere we went. The Riverwalk, French Quarter & Jackson Square are not terribly far from the hotel, but if you find walking to be difficult in your normal day to day activities, you probably need to consider having a car or taking a taxi to the areas mentioned above. Overall we enjoyed our time at this hotel & would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: atlantadog
Reviews.Content: Ended up staying in this hotel because most others were booked during Mardi Gras. Why there were vacancies is beyond me--the hotel was very reasonable (think we paid under $200/night), they provide both breakfast and dinner, the rooms are HUGE, and the staff was as warm and friendly as almost any other non-Ritz Carlton hotel in which I've ever stayed. Mardi Gras location is perfect--you are 2 blocks from the parade route, and a few more from the quarter. Getting in and out of the hotel during Mardi Gras can be a bit of a challenge due to traffic and parade routes, so get a schedule, and plan accordingly. Everyone complains about parking, but it's comparable with other hotels, and other than the fact that it's outdoors, it's a very minor hassle. Overall, two enthusiastic thumbs up. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but cost to park per day.....geeez”
Reviews.Author: gator007
Reviews.Content: clean, clean, clean all over the place. nice big rooms plenty of whatever you needed. Checkin, get dressed, leave and don't come back walking upright. this place was clean and that was the best part. Didn't need lounge, piano or bar (btw, there are bars in the french quarter), we used this room to sleep, shower and watch some TV....very little of all of it. In New Orleans as a visitor....GET OUT and enjoy it. This is our yearly adult only trip and if you saw 2 Vikings walking down the street Feb 4th that was ME !!!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best bargain in the city”
Reviews.Author: Reage55
Reviews.Content: While you can get cheaper rooms in New Orleans, this hotel is amazingly inexpensive for the quality and service. You will pay under two hundred dollars for a room per night, but you get two real rooms, breakfast and dinner included. The entire staff from the front desk to maids and repair crew are friendly, polite, and helpful. It impressed me enough that I made a call to the general manager to express my admiration for pairing quality employees with a quality hotel. Regardless of the purpose of your trip, do not underestimate the value of having two rooms. If it is business, you, perhaps, do not really want to invite a person to your bedroom---especially of the opposite sex---for a private conversation. If the trip is personal, you have the luxury of allowing one person to watch television or chat without disrupting somebody else's time to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family stay during holidays”
Reviews.Author: danalynn1128
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 month old son, and my mom spent three nights at this hotel as part of a family trip between Christmas and New Year's. We went through a lot of angst over what kind of hotel arrangements would be right for us and splurged with getting a 2 BR suite for us and the baby, and getting my mom her own 1 BR suite. The prices were such a bargain, however, this wasn't a "break-the-bank" splurge! More importantly, we were delighted with our stay in every way! Our rooms were enormous, which was especially nice for fitting in all the gear that comes with a baby. We brought a pack-n-play for him (the cribs at the hotel are the mini ones, which he's outgrown) and it fit easily into a corner of his bedroom. The beds were comfortable, but softer than is ideal for us. The kitchenette is adequate, but a little disappointing on the provisions. There was no dish soap or dishwasher soap, no mixing bowls and no stopper for the sink (it had a garbage disposal, so the strainer couldn't fit in closer and function as a stopper...we improvised by putting a glass in upside down). The water pressure in the showers was not great and one in particular took forever to get hot water going. Beyond the rooms, the facility was great! Welcoming lobby and dining areas. Lovely pool!!! Good laundry facilities and business center. We loved the location!!! We were a few short blocks from Canal Street and had no noise issues at all. We felt very safe and were pleased with eating options nearby (although there weren't many). A great find at the end of our stay was a new, high-end grocery store (Rouses) just a few blocks away! Fantastic!!! The staff was oustanding in every way. They offered free bagged ice when needs exceeded what the freezer made. They gave great advice on where to go. Altogether, it was an outstanding stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Classic, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Feudalord7
Reviews.Content: Hotel is downtown and went well above and beyond my expectations. The room was enormous! There was a full living room and separate room with a door with the beds. The bathroom was huge, clean, updated, and the water pressure was great. The rooms on the upper floors have balconies that overlook the street, but it's all very cool architecture and I found it pretty relaxing just hanging out there for half an hour. They have an indoor pool and a gym but I only used the gym. It had two treadmills, and elliptical, some free weights, and a tv...it was enough for me since there was no one else in there. As with other Homewoods, they have a Manager's dinner from 5:00-7:00 on Monday through Thursday with FREE beer and wine (both white and red). The value you get for your money is great when compared to other hotels in the area. I'll definitely try to stay at this hotel next time I'm in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spacious suite”
Reviews.Author: Stacy P
Reviews.Content: We reserved a two bedroom suite. Our suite was on 7th floor. The suite was very spacious, with free internet and kitchenette. This hotel has a great hot breakfast, that was very enjoyable. It was a 10 minute walk to French quarter or the Riverwalk area. Street car service is close by. Parking is $18.00 + tax extra per day. Good value for such large suite size. Highly recommend this hotel. We plan to stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice for your Nawlins trip”
Reviews.Author: jguillet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for Thanksgiving week. About four blocks from Bourbon and the French Quarter, and two from the St. Charles streetcars. They have a nice morning breakfast and lite supper Monday-Thursday. Different food each day and the kids liked it. The rooms are large and clean. The sofabed is unbearable, though. One of the few hotels to offer two queen size beds, so that's a big plus. Staff was very friendly. Recommended. There's a GREAT brand new supermarket called Rouses at 701 Baronne, about two blocks away. Great store to get stuff for your stay, since you have a small kitchen in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: bdavis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times this year as a place to recuperate from surgery. Each room was spacious, and the bed so very comfortable, but that is just the beginning. For a low nightly rate, the hotel is near the Quarter, includes breakfast, includes dinner (midweek), is clean, and modern. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!...Not so sure about eCheck-in.”
Reviews.Author: gr3158
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Oct.22 to Oct.29 and overall we were extremely satisfied with this hotel. Now the problem................ I booked my stay in April and I and I used eCheck-in following the eCheck-in rules. I was told I had room a room on the 9th floor with a balcony. ( I think it was 910). This was perfect and I was extremely pleased with the eCheck-in process. Then when we arrived and we were told that that room was not ready for us yet which was not a problem as we did arrive a little bit early. We were told that that room would be ready in a couple of hours. The girl at the desk secured our luggage and we went for a walk around the city. We returned a couple of hours later and I was told that we could not have room 910 because someone else was in that room. WHY ?? I thought I had secured that room with eCheck In? She told me that she had moved us to room 216. We went to room 216 and I found a much smaller room that the suite I had seen online! Then I went out on the balcony and there was a commercial fan mounted about 8ft up on the wall and this was the loudest fan I had ever heard. There also did not appear any way to turn it off. This would have made it impossible to enjoy this balcony with my wife. There was no way I was spending 7 nights in this tiny, noisy room. I returned to the desk and informed the girl that this room was not acceptable. She checked availabilty again and told me that I could have room 1114 which was a full size suite without a balcony. I told her that would be fine and we waited in the lobby until that room was ready. At about 4:45 we finally were in this room. The room was great, large, very clean and lots of room. Nice kitchen area with all you needed for a nice comfortable stay. The rest of our stay there was very nice. The included daily breakfast buffet was nice. ( it was also a money and time saver) Didn't have to waste half your morning looking for a place to have breakfast. The evening "welcome home dinner" (mon-thurs) was also a nice feature even if you just needed a break and wanted to relax for a little bit with a light meal and a glass of beer or wine before venturing out to explore more of the city. This hotel is also in a nice location. Within walking distance to the French Quarter and 2 blocks to the St Charles streetcar so it was close to everything if you utilize the streetcar system. Nice hotel, friendly staff, nice large and clean suites, breakfast and evening light meal.......what more could you want for an extremely reasonable nightly rate. I highly recommend this hotel for your trip to NOLA. When I return I will definately stay at "Homewwod Suites". My only issue was the eCheck-In. Why would you offer this option if you can't get the room you reserved. eCheck-In states "check in on line and just stop by the desk and get your room key". Didn't work that way for me and I hope others have better luck with it than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied Customers”
Reviews.Author: breezes2
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed 7 nights at this hotel, from October 15 to October 22, 2011. It is located just outside of the French Quarter, ( About a 15 minute walk to Jackson Square.) or (Two blocks from the nearest streetcar stop). The rooms were clean, spacious, and well maintained. All rooms have a fully equipped kitchenette,and a fully furnished living room. The bedroom is separated from the Living room by a set of double doors and is furnished with 2 double beds. The bathroom, which is off the bedroom, is separated from the vanity area. The room has two T.V.'s,( one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Also included is free ethernet hook ups in the room and free U.S.A. Today papers delivered to your door on weekday mornings. Buffet breakfasts are included daily and buffet dinners with wine and beer on weekdays. If your looking for the most bang for your buck, you can't beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rcjwill
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night to go to a concert at the New Orleans Arena. Rooms are clean. Close to everything. We walked to the Arena. The rooms are spacious, comes complete with full kitchen and free internet! Bed are comfotable....You even get a free hot breakfast! I would recommend my friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Noga A
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel on the end of June 2011. 1. Location - Close to the French Quarter .The Canal st. and the Bourbon st., is about 5-8 minutes walk. 2. The suite - Very spacious, comfortable beds. Full kitchen, including cutlery, dishes and dishwasher. A big Lcd TV. And a free internet. We had also a little balcony which was awesome. For us it was a very convenient suite. 3. The hotel â€“ It is a friendly hotel. In this hotel the suite price included breakfast and light dinner (in the midweek), they call it, Welcome Home reception, but its' actually a kind of a dinner. There is a computer room with printers so it was very convenient to do and print the check-in to our flight back to New York. 4. We will recommend to all our friends this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob P
Reviews.Content: Just spent five nights (10/11/11---10/24/11) to attend 50th Tulane Reunion. This place was great, good location, great beds, great complimentary breakfasts, friendly staff, reasonable rates and a hard working, involved manager (very important for this kind of facility). Whenever I go back to New Orleans I'm staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Homewood Suites New Orleans Oct. 2011”
Reviews.Author: bmccollum
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel Oct. 21-23, 2011 with my wife and daughter. Great location. Far enough away from the madness of Bourbon Street / French Quarter, but easy walking distance to those areas of about 15-20 minutes. Hotel was very, very clean. Room (#302) was near-spotless and very comfortable. Had a good view from balcony down several streets. Streets surrounding hotel were very quiet and only heard loud music / ambulances / etc. once or twice during our 2-night stay there. About a 5-min. walk down to the St. Charles / Carondelet intersections to catch the streetcars. Pool looked clean but we didn't use it. Used the hot tub and was very clean. Both pool / hot tub are indoor. Staff was friendly enough. Parking was about $20 per day in a nearby adjacent, uncovered lot. Didn't have any qualms parking the car there. We found the breakfast to be fresh, hot, and very good. It's complimentary (the breakfast). They had an assortment to choose from... scrambled eggs, grits, cereals, watermelon, several different juices, make your own waffles, etc. Breakfast seating area was very busy though, but no big deal... we just sat at an adjacent sitting area in the front of the hotel and it was fine. Leaking tub faucet in room 302 needs fixed, but was no big deal. Dripping was minimal and quiet and didn't keep us awake. Would stay here again without question... very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Illinoiasgal
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with all aspects of this hotel. The room was nice and clean. Good variety of food at the breakfast. We didn't ever try the evening offerings but they always looked nice and many were eating there. The staff was excellent, especially Kiana at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a group”
Reviews.Author: AEF_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few days ago with a couple of friends. We had a very spacious 2 bedroom suite that had everything you could want, including kitchenette, complementary breakfasts, and complementary light dinner Mon to Thurs (with wine or beer). New Orleans has such great restaurants, but sometimes a big lunch and light dinner in the hotel were just what we needed. The staff were all very friendly, as is everyone in New Orleans. It's not right in the French Quarter, but it's only about 3 or so short blocks to get to Canal Street, about 25-30 mins stroll to Frenchmen Street - the best place for great music. Ultimately this is a chain hotel, so you don't get the intimate experience you'd get in a B&B, but for a group it was ideal and extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: SFGiants
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days before embarking on our cruise. Rooms were spacious and clean. Hot breakfast downstairs was included. They also had muffins, bagels, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee. Really liked the waffles, which you made yourself. Staff at the front desk were very helpful with directions and always friendly. The business center had a couple of computers to use for free and the indoor swimming pool was nice. The French Quarter was about a 10 minute walk away. I enjoyed our stay here and would come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Tina B
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and we had our 2yrs old daughter and my in-laws with us. We picked the Homewood Suites b/c it was recommened as family friendly and far enough away from the action in the area for some peace and quiet. I have to say this was a very nice hotel and we were very pleased! We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite, the bedrooms were spacious and the living room and kitchen area were large too and no one felt cramped, there was more than enough room. It was a clean hotel and the maid service was good as well. Another reason we stayed here is b/c they offer a daily hot breakfast, it was good too. They had eggs, bagels/bread, muffins, cereal, yougurt, and juice each morning but the meat changed daily and they sometimes had waffles. They also offered a dinner buffet I think Monday-Thursday evenings, we had that the first day we arrived since it was later in the day....it's nothing grand but the food is decent. The pool area is nice and not crowded, at least when we were there. They also have a nice business center. Also their outside doors lock to the public at 10pm and the only way to get in is by swiping your room key, which I think is a good idea and safe. Location, location, location!! Like I mentioned it's far enough away from Bourbon St and other attractions (Jackson Sq, French Market), but still close enough to walk to those places. I would say it's a good 6 or so blocks to Canal St. We walked to those areas daily, just bring decent walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Reage55
Reviews.Content: This property meets the traditional standards of the Hilton Chain in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelor84
Reviews.Content: This is a great place albeit far from Bourbon, Frenchmen and the convention Center. The breakfast bar has simple food. The managers reception was ok. Not much of food selection like a Drury but unlimited beer and wine. Cab to the convention center cost about 10 bucks. Staff is hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sthack
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay here at the Homewood Suites in NOLA!! What a perfect place to stay......great location, clean, comfortable and a very accommodating staff!! I would highly recommend this hotel. I'm not sure what some of the others mean about 'major renovation needed'??? We stayed on the 12th floor, 1 Bedroom suite w/2 queen beds and our suite was EXCELLENT!! No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Room B-A-D Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: rcarmenhawkins
Reviews.Content: The room was OK, but there was hair on the bathroom floor. I hoped that it would be swept during clean up the next morning, but was not. I had to ask that it be done. We used the sleeper sofa and left it open so that the sheets would be changed out. This was not done either -- I had to call down to have them changed. We had planned to have breakfast at the hotel each morning, but it was so bad the first day that we had to go out for breakfast. I did not expect anything fancy -- just the usual complimentary breakfast, but there was no bacon or sausage (I was told that canned hash was their meat for the day), the bagels were rock solid frozen. I had to pry them apart and zap them in the mico to cut in half. They were out of cream cheese, no pastries, and the juice was at room temp when we went down for bkfst around 8:30 AM. There was a bug (alive and moving) in the fruit, there was a very limited amount of choices (no yogurt or pastries) and the staff spoke poor English. I spoke to a manager who apologized, but did not say she would correct the problem, which was very disappointing. We ended up spending extra $ to have bkfst elsewhere -- an extra $120 over the 4 days we were in NOLA that we had not planned on spending.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location but need major renovation”
Reviews.Author: IgorCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Just spend three nights for the convention. Pros: Large suites. Soft beds. Very nice reception people, helpful and professional. Free Internet, Free OK breakfast. Free happy hour (did not use). New flat screen TV sets (nice). Clean rooms. Nice price. Cons: Outdated room design and furniture. Absolutely terrible AC units (woke up about 10 times every night. Sounded like a helicopter) The sink was broken. I did not ask for fixing it though. A fridge was making a lot of noise while trying to make ice (no water line though). The toilet flashed on its own a few times every night. Overall, a nice hotel on the budget, but not as comfortable as Hilton I got used to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Decent location”
Reviews.Author: tkherold
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean. Good location. Nice breakfast (basic homewood suites type of stuff but well done). We had a problem with the room. We booked a 2 room suite with 2 kings but none were available on the first night. I feel this was more the hilton honors problem but the staff was nice a got us in athe right room the next day. We will have to wait to see if they were able to credit some hilton honors points back. Overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF AND PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: GOLDENGIRL054
Reviews.Content: Loved This Hotel. From the Moment I Arrived. Young Lady at The Front Desk Was So Accomodating. I Had A Request and In the blink of an eye it happened. I Believe her name was Kiana. I Had called a couple of times prioir to arrival and spoke to Lasandra? She was also extremely helpful. These young ladies know the true meaning of hospitality. Hotel was very clean and my room was so spacious I could have lived there. Fitness center was very nice and clean. There was so much to do I never even went to the pool.. The breakfast was usual homewood fare with some yummy fresh cut fruit every morning. I Had the opportunity to eat one evenong and that was also quite good. The Hotel is located within walking distance of many attractions and very close to the streetcar. Bourbon Street is an easy breezy walk. I loved this city and I loved this hotel. I will definitely stay here again. A New restaurant is opening in November called City Greens and I've heard nothing but great things about it. Anxious to try it. Enjoy this City. it has so much to offer. You will definitely feel safe at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for long stays.”
Reviews.Author: bnlsoram
Reviews.Content: Nice place for families. Great breakfast every day and the manager's special through the week. Laundry facility helpful for long stays. Parking can be tricky if you get in late but attendants help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zmatca3
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice hotel. The hotel was not quite as good as the reviews would lead you to believe. Great location near French Quarter. Housekeeping seemed understaffed and overwhelmed on the floor where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel for family and great service”
Reviews.Author: kbissinger
Reviews.Content: We came to NO for the Jr. Olympic Track meet. Hotel provided large suites for family and great service. Meal plan helped with budget. We would definitely book this hotel again in NO.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families or Group of Friends”
Reviews.Author: StarAlly
Reviews.Content: Friends and I went down to New Orleans and decided to try Homewood Suites since seven of us would be traveling together. The space and set up was perfect. Seven males fit very comfortably in two rooms. We loved the free wi-fi and the front desk staff remained quite friendly even though it was fairly busy. Kudos to them. There were a number of families and the hot breakfast was a huge draw and nice perk (so was the free wi-fi). Everything was pretty standard tho - linens, pull out couch was leather, neutrogena products, swimming pool. I'd recommend it for the budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Passenger2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Poydras Street Hotel for five nights and we were very happy with this hotel. We had a two bedroom suite and apart from the closet doors not working properly we had no other problems. We called the desk and received prompt service to fix the doors, the hotel room was not sparkling clean but neither could you call it dirty, unlike some pf the places we have stayed in the big easy. Great value for money, good breakfast selection, staff were very friendly, even had evening meals from the Tuesday to Thurdsay evenings. Parking was not a problem just around the corner on a lot on the side street, unlike a lot of places which are really tight this was open and easy. We found it was not too far to walk to the Quarter or the Riverwalk Mall. This will be our home from home whenever we get the opportunity to visit New Orleans. Note: If you have children do not miss a visit to the zoo - it is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again - great w families”
Reviews.Author: TheCarolinaTraveller
Reviews.Content: The pros include the good breakfast: Included is eggs, some sort of meat, cereals, bread and pastry, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juices, etc. Something for everyone. Even nutrigrain bars and poptarts. Our room was a large suite which included a kitchenette. There is a grocery store about a 10 minute walk away in the French quarter (Rouses Market) which is pricey but included everything you need. Also, only on Monday thru Thursday, they include a light serve yourself dinner and sodas, and beer (Abita!) and wine. I saw a lot of families taking advantage of this. Who wants to feed a three year old in the French Quarter? For dinner think soup, fruit, salad, pasta, some sort of light protein (chicken nuggets) - stuff like that. Room was comfortable and quiet. The 5 ft deep indoor pool was ok but not large enough to really have fun. The business / computer room on the mezzanine level was useful for looking things up on the internet and printing boarding passes and coupons. However, the internet was slow. Overall, this was a good stay. No serious problems and it was really clean, well kept and exceptionally safe area. Very close to walking to the French quarter without being in the melee. You do not need a car while staying here. Cab to the hotel is a standard $33 for 1 or two people. Parking is $19 a day. Fitness center is very nice but small.

Reviews.Title: “Made me feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Dawnahp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites New Orleans from November 2010 until May 2011. The staff went out of their way to make me feel at home. Everyone was very nice and went the extra mile to make my extended stay as enjoyable as possible. Having the separate living and sleeping area was crucial during my extended stay, and the extra room would be nice anytime. The evening meal M-Th was especially nice since I was working exteneded hours, and the daily hot breakfast always included fresh fruit, and a warm greeting from Margarita, my favorite member of my Homewood family.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: 3riverz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel a little more quiet at night, this would be good choice. Near Mothers on Poydras. Parking is behind hotel, can get crowded during the day M-F, as it is in the business district. Breakfast is decent , nothing spectacular. Get a room higher up that faces Poydras.......less noise, but you can look down and see the action. It is a walk to French Quarter, so wear comfortable shoes, or catch the plentiful cabs. Front desk help has been very kind and welcoming both times.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: booklady615
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The rooms were comfortable and the beds terrific. The hotel provided a great breakfast everyday and dinner Mon-Thurs. We took advantage of breakfast but not dinner. There are too many wonderful places to eat in NO. One note though, the trash trucks arrive at 5:20 am. We were on the third floor and heard them every morning. Maybe a room on a higher floor would be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms, wonderful amenities”
Reviews.Author: caroltravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 children, 20 and 16, using HHonors Points. Not sure why, maybe husband's Diamond VIP status, but we had a huge 2 bedroom/2 bath suite. Each bedroom had a king bed and there was a queen sofa sleeper in the living room. The smaller of the 2 bedrooms had a small balcony. Add in the standard Homewood Suites kitchen and we could have moved in for a week rather than just 3 nights. We did have a few complaints with the elevators and the parking. The elevators were incredibly slow causing major backups on Sunday morning during checkout. Parking is self-parking in a surface lot 1/2 block from the hotel. The lot gets extremely full so it is sometimes necessary to leave ones keys with the attendant. They squeeze a lot of cars into very tight spaces. Breakfast was average at best but it filled the bill since a standard hotel breakfast is not what one comes to New Orleans to eat. We needed an early morning cab which the front desk gladly arranged for us; the cab and breakfast bag were waiting when we got downstairs at 5:15 a.m. The location, as others have mentioned, is ideal. Close enough to walk to the Quarter, casino, streetcar, and nearby restaurants but far enough from the noise and crowds. We will definitely stay here again on another visit to a city that is coming back stronger and better than ever.

Reviews.Title: “middling, at best”
Reviews.Author: FAMILY44444
Reviews.Content: -- slow internet -- only one elevator was working, and it was slow -- average, at best, breakfast -- rooms cheap (although big) -cabinets, wallpaper, fixtures, etc, all bottom of the line -- old - carpeting and wallpaper worn -- location: to me, not a plus, unlike other reviews I thought it was a long walk to get anywhere. -- no newspapers -- rooms dark (because of balconies, but still . . .) -- sensor turns off AC if it fails to detect movement, but can be disabled

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: higandhug
Reviews.Content: We love Homewood Suites. We went to NO with a 9 and 13 year old. The hotel is perfect for families. We enjoyed breakfast and the dinner and drinks in the evening. The people who served the food could not have been nicer. We also loved the location. We walked everywhere we went except the zoo. The hotel is situated so you can get almost anywhere you want to go. My 9 year old loved the pool. We stayed on the 2nd floor in room #213 right above the pool. Although we did not hear any noise, our room smelled like chlorine. I think next time we will ask for a different floor. I would highly recommend this hotel! Nice to get those Hilton Honors points, too!

Reviews.Title: “Best mardi gras ever,,,”
Reviews.Author: Skolikat
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious. There was great hot breakfast and a nightly dinner. The staff was very friendly. Great place for parade watching. Only had to walk 2 blocks!,

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: DynastyLegend
Reviews.Content: Breakfast AND dinner- if you can tear yourself away from all of NOLAs area restaurants- Emeril's nearby and cozy Mother's for pivots and gumbo. Real food that changes daily, stuffed flounder one night, bbq hamburgers the next served with fountain soft drinks, wine and beer you serve yourself. Rooms come complete with pots and pans, dish ware and dish washer. Coin operated laundry room next to the fitness room and overlooking the pool to check on your teens and tweens. Rooms have soft beds, pull out sofa, chaise lounge and French door bedroom but you pay $20 for parking. Super walmart is less than five mins away.

Reviews.Title: “horrible stay!!”
Reviews.Author: melz0823
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say I've experienced better customer service at a DMV than at this establishment. There was a misunderstanding regarding payment. On our second day there, we arrived back to the room to find ourselves locked out of our suite. When we came back down to the lobby, DENISE at the front desk pointed at our party and said scathingly "YOU! Come here" and beckoned us to the desk with her index finger like we were schoolchildren. She then proceeded to rudely tell us that she was reprimanded by her manager for allowing us to stay in the room when it was unpaid for, then blamed US for "getting her into trouble." OBVIOUSLY we were going to pay for our room, we had 7 ppl's personal belongings in there all day! Yet they felt the need to lock us out, then speak to us like we were complete trash. From the mgr, we received NOT ONE apology for Denise's rude behavior. When told that we'd decided to check out IN THE MIDDLE OF OUR STAY for another hotel, the manager STILL did not apologize ONCE, nor did she try to maintain our business. We knew we had had it when we went to the desk one more time on our final few hours there. Denise saw us standing on line to the desk, rolled her eyes, and said loudly to the other employee "Can you see what THESE PEOPLE want?" We ended up going to the HILTON ST CHARLES down the street, which turned out to be the same price, and whose employees I can't speak any more highly of. They were so courteous and professional and went out of their way to make sure we had a seamless remainder of our stay. To have an awesome time in this amazing city, the only tip I have is to steer clear from Homewood Suites and anyone associated with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: laurenyulan
Reviews.Content: First visit to NOLA. Although understandable why, I at least have to say that it was very difficult to find a hotel downtown with an indoor pool for my kids. Thus, our primary reason for selecting this hotel. Well, I was not disappointed. It really is a beautiful hotel and all of the staff are very, very attentive. The food was good and it was plentiful. Pool was nice as well as the hot tub. We had a two bedroom suite. Each bedroom had its own bathroom and we loved that the king room had a balcony. It was a little pricey but we really enjoyed the extra room and with both breakfast and dinner included, it was worth it. All in all, a very nice stay. About an easy 4 block walk to the quarter and very close to the St. Charles streetcar. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: OzzieLaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week between Christmas & New Year's, and overall were very impressed. There was one odd maintenance issue (missing shower curtain) that took longer than it should have to be fixed (noonish the next day), but after that, we had no problems. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food at breakfast was good and decent at the manager's reception. It saved us a lot of money, because our three teenagers were content to eat here, supplemented with snacks from the nearby mini-mart. So we were able to splurge on lunch instead of eating out 3x a day. The location was great, only 1-1/2 blocks from a St. Charles streetcar stop, and only 4 blocks from Canal Street at Bourbon. It would have been nice if we could have gotten our bus passes at the hotel, but we didn't have to walk too far not the French Quarter to get those. We had a 2-room suite, and it was a bit pricey. But it was NOLA during the holidays, and the on-site food saved us a lot on meals. And the extra space made the trip mush less stressful than a smaller room. So, it was a fair trade-off. All-in-all, a very pleasant visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: trishbella
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our family. We have 3 small children. You can't beat the free breakfast and free dinner! We would walk to the street car and take it down to Jackson Square. Sight seeing, lunch, a carriage ride and of course beignets. Then back to the hotel for dinner and a swim in the indoor heated pool and hot tub. We all had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “A second review from your extended stay business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: There's good and bad about this hotel. The good: 1. Location 2. Very good breakfast and hosted evening meals The bad: 1. This an older Homewood that's beginning to show its age in terms of carpet, walkways, walls, rooms etc. 2. Daily pay to park fee for $18.00+. On one side this IS downtown New Orleans. But this is an "extended stay" hotel. So as I see no problem paying to park daily at the Renaissance or Hilton for a short term business trip but stay here for over one week and your parking bill is getting pretty expensive. One would think that longer term guests could get a pro-rated flat rate upon check out at least. 3. Old CRT TVs. Time to get rid of those dinosaurs and save on your electricity bill. 4. Internet. Another one of most Hilton properties hotel that needs to use a dictionary in defining "high speed". Sharing an entire hotel with hundreds of guests over a basic DSL connection doesn't cut it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs update/improvement, but good location”
Reviews.Author: OftenTravelGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 12th floor. Room needed updating. I don't expect 25 in tube TVs in big city hotels like Homewood suites had. Should be flat screen TVs. New Orleans hotels are not cheap, get off the dime Homewood Suites and buy Flat Screen TVs. Next, you look up at the air conditioning vents and it's full of dust, dirt and mold. Not good for the sinuses. Luckily the weather was beautifu,l when we were in New Orleans, and as much as possible we just left our balcony door open and received air from the outside. Maintenance did come into the room to change out Air Condition filter and I showed him the air ducts. He agreed they were dirty and stated he would let housekeeping know. No action was taken during our week stay. The kitchen in the room was nice and did come in handy. The morning breakfast ends at 0930. I travel a lot and that is very early, especially in a location like New Orleans, where Bourbon Street can be a late night adventure, most hotels serve their breakfast until 10:30 or 11:00. We tried the breakfast a few mornings, not that tasty. The Afternoon managerâ€™s food/beer and wine, was draft beer, white or red wine. All other previous Homewood Suites I've stayed in had bottle beer, white, blush and red wine and the food was much better than served at this New Orleans Homewood Suites. Heck, this hotel is in the heart of New Orleans, there has got to be a local person that can cook up some decent New Orleans style food. Until this hotel puts more effort in their breakfast and Managersâ€™ event, my advice is to skip it and go to the local restaurants. On the positive side, the in-door pool was nice and the location of this hotel was excellent. Close to Bourbon Street and the business district. Bottom line, this is a below average big city hotel in an excellent location, so I have it three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: RJR72410
Reviews.Content: For my husbands work we have been staying at this hotel, will be here fo a couple months. The staff is very friendly and even the manager does everything he can to make sure every guest is satisfied. The hotel is clean and comfy. Breaksfast is served daily and even dinner free for guest mon-thur. The only downside is that the a/c works via sensor on the thermostat. The thermostat is in the living room area of the suite so at night it tends to kick off because the sensor does not "sense" our presence and will kick off making it hot and humid. my husband and I take turns getting up to make it kick back on. I think the sensor idea is neat that ac will kick off when no one is in the room to save on electricity and energy and back on when some one enters the room, but there should be a way to override that setting when people are sleeping at night esp in a different room. Otherwise all the amenities are great. The employees here show their customers are important. My husband had hit his head causing great concern and the front desk people were helpful, they even called later on in the evening to make sure he was ok and asked that we call down if we needed anything. The housekeepers are all very kind and always friendly with a smile. It's a nice home away from home and located close to a lot of the city attractions and resturaunts. I'd rate it 4 out of 5. would be 5 if not for the ac

Reviews.Title: “The greatest hotel and manager”
Reviews.Author: scottvirginia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and even more so after our second stay. The manager welcomed us and made us feel like it was home and even gave us a bottle of wine to commemorate our return. The food was outstanding and the gracious staff coundnt do enough for us. New Orleans is special and we just loved the hotel, the town, the people, the trolly cars, food, free Christmas music downtown. Very very special hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value”
Reviews.Author: DrTravelers
Reviews.Content: A short walk to Bourbon St., clean, great service and a fabulous free continental breakfast (eggs, waffles, sausage, biscuits plus all the usual other stuff)- can't beat it! Only complaint was that the wiireless internet was pokey slow- had to plug in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....unless you have a car”
Reviews.Author: westcoasthazel
Reviews.Content: I found Homewood Suites to be clean and comfortabe. I stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 11th floor. The room was spacious with a full kitchen complete with dishes and silverware, towels, etc. There was a pull-out sofa in the living room as well. I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet the room was. I barely ever heard any noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms. There is also a laundry room onsite for hotel guests. The staff was always very friendly and courteous. The hotel is walking distance to the French Quarter. I only have two complaints: (1) Maintenance problems - the first few days I was there, I had a problem with the toilet. I called the front desk to request maintenance. The desk clerk informed me that there wasn't a maintenance person onsite but that housekeeping would bring a plunger for me to use. No one ever brought a plunger. I ended up fixing the problem myself. (2) the parking lot - Other reviewers have described the condition of this lot and the difficulty in parking. Everything they have said is true. The parking lot is an open self park lot down a dark side street behind the hotel. The lot is badly deteriorating and is sorely in need of resurfacing and re-striping. The lines between parking spots are so faded as to be barely visible, especially at night. The only way to fully appreciate the condition of this lot is to see it in person. One night I parked next to a large SUV that was parked at an angle which prevented me from parking straight. The next morning I found a "parking violation" notice on my window warning that I was "illegally parked" because my car was not exactly within the lines. I'm not sure how I can be "illegally parked" in a space I was paying $19 a day to use. The "notice" also warned that future violations would result in my car being towed. Unbelievable. So, if you have a car, I would advise staying anywhere else. There is a Hilton hotel about 5 blocks away if you want to be at a Hilton property, otherwise there is a Drury Inn right across the street or numerous other options around town that have a better parking situation. But if you don't have a car, I think this hotel is a good and reasonably priced option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MASMO
Reviews.Content: This is a great downtown hotel with easy access to the French Quarter. The staff was great too. I feel that Homewood Suites are the best chain. I was a little skeptical about the self parking across the street, but the attendants were great and I had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “parking lot dangerous for guests, lousy gym”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravelerdc
Reviews.Content: It is self-park at this hotel and the lot is located 1/2 block away down a dark alley. moreover, although you have in and out privileges, during the day cars are stacked up in the lot such that you have to wait for parking lot attendant to move cars out of the way, or must wait until space opens up so that you can park. The gym is pathetic with third-rate equipment and not much of it. Air conditioning system in the rooms is incredibly loud and the only way to sleep is to turn it off (not necessarily an option for a summer stay). Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect suites, perfect location, perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: MWC2009
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was wonderful. We found the management and staff to be very friendly and accommodating. We were in town with our young children to attend a Saint's game and stayed in one of their two-bedroom suites. The suite was very spacious and clean. The hotel was just a short walk from the Super Dome. Their complimentary breakfast offered a wide variety of many items for our family to enjoy. (Our children especially enjoyed making their own waffles). Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Like environment”
Reviews.Author: CougarLouisiana
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Homewood Suites in New Orleans while working throught the year 2008-2009 and was very pleased with the service and accommedations during my stay from the staff. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: hyflyr0552
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites on Poydras for several weeks while on extended assignment in New Orleans. I must say that in all my extensive travels the front desk staff and management were the most inept I have ever encountered! The front desk staff never made me feel welcomed and could not handle the smallest request for maintenence or housekeeping. They even checked me in and gave me a room key to a room that was already occupied! Complaints to management never really changed things. They even charged two weeks of my room to another guest! I only stayed because the place was close to my office and the breakfast staff did an awsome job. But after several weeks of frustration I finally checked out and found another place to stay. Several business associates also left because of poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Essence Music Festival - Stay”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgreen1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was adequate rooms were spacious and clean for our group of 6 girlfriends 35+ in age - we had a two bedroom suite, the kitchen was convenient for beverages and warming up leftover (doggiebags) etc. - there was a small balcony off the king bedroom but no view - the side of a buiding and the parking lot was the view...location was close to the Superdome which was our purpose...I frequent Homewood Suites typically with my children - I found this Homewood Suite to be the worst of all I've stayed - decor, service and all. We found it insulting that this establishment required all guest to wear florescent green wrist bands for our entire stay - and if not worn during the breakfast hours, you were denied service - even if you had your room key. WOW. The front desk staff lacked any knowledge of the area, dinning, entertainment etc. The Essence Music Festival is a major event in the town of New Orleans, you'd think this hotel would have been prepared - particularly since they were sold out that weekend (July 3rd - 6th)...This hotel made my group feel less than welcomed and rather restrictive. AND to our shock...while walking down the streets of N.O. someone recognized our florescent bands and identified what hotel we were staying at - WHAT A SAFTY HAZARD for a group of women traveling the streets of N.O. This hotel must find another way to identify it's patrons without the use of such tactics. Shame on Homewood Suites N.O. - and yes, it is time for an upgrade. This hotel just does not make you feel special. Next year for the E.M.F. we will choose differently...

Reviews.Title: “Very good and very bad in one place”
Reviews.Author: hotfoot101
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and stayed at this hotel for several weeks. The front desk service is the absolute worst I have ever seen in a hotel. Please, send those kids on some hospitality training. I was afraid to ask them anything because they never knew or could never help.. or try to help. I got several pieces of mail and was never once notified that a piece had arrived... so it could sit for days or weeks without someone lifting a finger. I asked the front desk for extra hangers in June and I'm still waiting. My co-worker had his room charged to someone else's credit card for two weeks in a row, and the front desk still hasn't realized something went wrong. (He only noticed after he checked out and is contacting Hilton management about the error.) On the flip side, however, I stayed as long as I did because of the better-than-expected breakfasts and dinners. Not magnificent, but pretty good for a complimentary service. I especially liked the assortment of fresh fruit with every meal. And unlike the front desk, the kitchen staff new about good service. Thank goodness. The suites were spacious, the beds were comfortable. The electrical sockets didn't all work. The water was gone for an entire weekend and Monday morning while I was there. The building is not the newest or best maintained, but I wouldn't say it was dirty or falling apart. I do understand some previous comments about smokey non-smoking rooms because I've smelt smoke coming from non-smoking rooms several times. (7th floor is supposed to be the smoking floor.) Other amenities: there is complimentary wireless (and wired) internet service, a computer room with 2 or 3 computers, a gym with 2 or 3 older treadmills and dumb bells, and a guest laundry room with 3 washers and 4 dryers.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking Room!”
Reviews.Author: kmefcf
Reviews.Content: I booked a non-smoking room (months and months in advance) and got a smoking room. The room really reeked and even the "Ozone Treatment' they did to the room did not help. There seemed to be a lot of people living at this hotel for a very extended amount of time. If I had it to do over, I would have booked at the Hampton Inn. It's a little closer to the French Quarter, right on the trolley line and has lots of stuff near it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 6 day stay”
Reviews.Author: snoopdoug
Reviews.Content: Homewood suites was a good choice. The staff was very friendly, location was perfect for a family 10 mins. walk to the quarter and 15 to 20 min. walk to the river or warehouse district. The breakfast and welcome home dinner was better than expected. The pool was very nice and never crowded. A great way too get out of the heat. On the down side the room we stayed in was a bit musty smelling and the carpet could use some cleaning. Our feet or socks turned black while walking around the room.

Reviews.Title: “Room was a little depressing”
Reviews.Author: luischable
Reviews.Content: Having stayed the previous night at the Homewood Suites in Houston the New Orleans hotel seemed old fashioned. The rooms feel dated and poorly laid out- long thin front room. Although we had asked for a non smoking room we could still smell the smoke. Bed is comfortable and the bathrooms are big. We were told our floor had been made a Non Smoking floor a couple of months before but you could immediately smell the stale smoke as you opened the door. Asking for a change of room we were given another room on a different floor with exactly the same issue. They did try to help by putting in an ionizer for the evening which helped. The initial girl on checkin seemed more interested in her personal phone call than working with customers. Not a great start but apart from her all the other staff were friendly. Breakfast was poor and very basic. We looked at it but ate out instead. As with other reviews the parking seems odd but it is close to the hotel. Seems a shame not to include in the cost of the hotel but maybe alot of people come by air. It is a 15 minute walk to the French Qtr and it you are looking for romantic do not stay here. It is a good, clean base which would make a good value for a family but as a couple there are definitely better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable beds, excellent service, friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: youngatheart149
Reviews.Content: Homewood suites were clean comfortable and very accommodating. The rates were reasonable . The kitchen had a breakfast buffet every morning and every evening light buffet was available. People were wonderful and gave us suggestions of places to see. This was my first trip to New Orleans and will not be my last. It was great fun and I felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Class-A Hotel but find somewhere else to park.”
Reviews.Author: RyanWeather
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this was my first time ever in New Orleans, so I didn't know exactly what to expect of the city or its hotels. I was pleasantly surprised to find the Homewood right in downtown - it seems like they're usually only at the airport or in the suburbs. The hotel is very nice and very clean, and the staff is very helpful. We used points and were still upgraded to a 2-bedroom 2-bath suite. The hotel is rather new I would guess, as nothing seemed stained or worn out. Breakfast was great, always waffles, grains, cereals and juices + more hot food daily, one day was scrambled eggs with ham, and bacon; anither day was plain eggs and pancakes. Overall this hotel is a great choice but I have two complaints: 1) The lack of snacks: There are no vending machines at this hotel and the store at the front desk had a very limited selection - especially when it came to drinks and frozen foods. There are also no grocery/convenience stores within a few blocks, so after the first night we learned to stock up while we were out. 2) Parking: The parking offered is in a lot behind the hotel. It's convenient, but the lot itself is physically deteorating, expensive ($18 a day!) and on weekdays you WILL be parked in. The attendant can move cars that are in your way but it takes a while. Unfortunately, you are chared as part opf yoiur stay and can't choose to park anywhere else without paying for this lot - so that is a drawback. If possible, I would suggest you ditch your car and find a taxi or shuttle from the airport downtown, after that everything is either within walking distance or accesible via streetcar (including Loyola, Tulane, the Aquarium and the Audubon Park Zoo). Otherwise, be prepared to put up with the parking and you'll have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites-nice and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Deb62862
Reviews.Content: Our party of three adults stayed here for a long weekend last weekend and can't fault it at all. Although we didn't cook any meals in the room, there is a small stovetop, microwave, full size fridge, pots, pans, silverware and china if you you're in the mood to cook. We only used the coffee maker. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom plenty spacious. Its always nice to have the separate living room area to give you a bit more space. The free breakfast was plentiful, with enough choices to please anyone, from cold cereal to hot bacon and eggs. They kept the dining area nice and clean. We weren't there any of the evenings when they offer the manager's reception with cocktails and a light dinner, but the menu posted in the room sounded pretty nice. Parking is in a lot next to the building and does get full at night. We always found a spot, but I could see where you might not. Cabs are available out the side entrance door, lined up next to the hotel across the street. We never had a problem getting one to pull up to Homewood's side entrance to pick up up. We just waved at the first in line and they came right over. When we would head to the Quarter for drinks and dinner, we simply had the cab drop us at Canal and Bourbon and we walked the rest of the way. The fare for three adults was around $7.50 for this short ride. While we didn't get a chance to use it, the pool is quite large and looked very well maintained. Also, there is a very small store next to the front desk for essentials. I didn't shop there, but I imagine the items are higher priced than they would be at most retail stores. The only slight problem we had was at check in. I believe the guy checking us in must have been new because he had difficulty finding our reservation and then needed help checking us in from another desk clerk.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi0312
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of it's location near the Superdome, & it was in easy walking distance. However, be prepared to walk a little if you're planning to frequent the French Quarter. The room and bathroom were large and very well appointed and maintained. It was so nice to have the full kitchen, especially a frig with an icemaker! The breakfast was really more than I expected. The parking lot provided is very close & reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location- great hotel”
Reviews.Author: serie23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location on a quiet side of New Orleans. Only a 10 min walk to the French Quarter. Easy walking distance from the RiverWalk, Casino, Aquarium, Canal Street. We stayed there for 4 days and walked everywhere. They offer a light meal on late afternoons with beer and wine and that was nice. Nothing gourmet, but fruits and salad was fresh and the children enjoyed it. Our schedule was busy and we could only enjoy this meal once but is nice to have it. The place was clean and breakfast was the usual (although they ran out of coffe almost every morning and had to wait for new brewed pot), fresh fruit also with breakfast was nice (not the fruitfrom a jar) and the staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites in February after Mardi Gras was over. The hotel was in a great location, we were able to walk to the busy area of the French Quarter. The hotel is in a quieter location. One night we went down to Frenchman street and it was easy to get a cab back to the hotel. The staff at the hotel were excellent. Everyone was very pleasant. Checking in was easy and they let us know that parking on the street was available on the weekends, saving us the parking fee. The rooms were very clean and breakfast was included,although th breakfast is somewhat simple it met our needs. I can not say anything negative about this hotel I plan on visiting New Orleans again and will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you hate yourself”
Reviews.Author: WATrvlr
Reviews.Content: Fleeing a hurricane, we made a last minute reservation based on this hotel being rated #1 on Tripadvisor. I read all the other reviews which gave me high expectations but this hotel didnâ€™t even come close. The original reservation was for two nights but we ended up staying eight nights until we could go home. Had we known it would be such a long stay we would have checked out much earlier to find a better hotel. Here are the pros: 1. The beds and pillows are comfortable 2. There is a kitchen in every room 3. The director of sales is really helpful and friendly The cons: 1. The A/C compressor makes an awful rattling/buzzing noise every time it runs. Asked to have it looked at three times, no change. Not even a single apology from staff. 2. The refrigerator compressor is very loud, too. 3. Parking is off-site on a wide open surface lot. Walk out the front doors, around the corner, and down and across the street. If you come back at night and that lot is full, the front desk will tell you there's another lot "over there someplace" but can't give any more specifics. If you come and go during the weekdays the lot is overflowing with cars double and triple parked. You have to leave your keys with an attendant and then go back to retrieve your keys from him at 6pm. (We left our car parked and walked or took public transportation most of the time so we didn't have to turn our keys over.) 4. The closest decent restaurants are four or five blocks away. Not a big deal because the walk is well lit and seemed relatively secure. 5. The front desk staff is not friendly and doesnâ€™t care very much about the guests. If there wasnâ€™t another guest in front of me then I always felt like I was disturbing them from surfing the internet or playing computer games or whatever they were doing so intently on their screens. 6. The first time we extended our stay (I think after the first night) the agent assured me that it was taken care of and our keys would work. The next morning the housekeeper asked what time weâ€™d be checking out. I stopped at the front desk and, naturally, the stay hadnâ€™t been extended and the staff was terribly inconvenienced by me. 7. The second time I extended the stay (Iâ€™m a glutton for punishment by this point) the agent said there was a note on her computer saying not to extend the reservation. She couldnâ€™t figure out why the note was there, verified space was available, and extended it. 8. Breakfast was disappointing every day. We tended to go down later in the morning so Iâ€™m not sure if itâ€™s any better early on. They were always out of something, whether it was plates, bowls, fresh fruit, utensils, cerealâ€¦ always something missing. Iâ€™m no expert but I bet the health department would have an issue with the temperatures maintained on the hot and cold items. Thank God for the waffle maker, we used it every day! Oh, I almost forgot the fruit flies flying around the inside of the bread box. Ick. 9. The pool and hot tub temperatures are both very good but the chemicals are not properly balanced. I sat in the hot tub for a few minutes before the fumes burned my eyes too bad and I had to get out. The pool water changed my swim trunks to a new color. 10. The A/C in the lobby broke down at one point during our stay, they posted signs to let guests know. No big deal, I completely understand that those things happen. However, I think they turn the A/C off in all the public areas and the corridors during the evening hours and weekends when fewer people are around. I guess theyâ€™re trying to save a few dollars but itâ€™s a huge turn-off for anyone in the lobby, business center, gym, etc. 11. Both towel racks in our bathroom were about to fall off the wall. How could somebody not notice something so obvious and fix it? 12. Nobody (except the awesome director of sales) says â€œhelloâ€� or â€œgood morningâ€� or anything else. Even the GM doesnâ€™t seem to like to talk to guests. Out of four times passing by him he only made verbal contact once. Lame. 13. We stopped by the evening reception every time it happened but always ended up leaving to find dinner on our own. The white wine is room temperature and the red wine is empty. The individually wrapped crackers are somehow stale. The evening food has the same temperature and quantity issues as the breakfast. I donâ€™t know why it was such a bad experience. Maybe the stars aligned to make it so. If there had just been one or two problems I would be writing a very different review right now. Find someplace else to stay in the Big Easyâ€¦ there are many other options!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: StLMomma
Reviews.Content: My usual favorite hotel was bumped from our corporate travel website, so I searched TripAdvisor for a potential new favorite. All the good reviews about the Homewood Suites compelled me to give the hotel a try. I was well pleased - the accommodations were clean and in great shape. The room was spacious and comfortable. The staff was very warm and friendly. Don't expect to be wowed by the breakfast or evening meal - they're the weak point here. But with all the great food in NOLA, it's no problem. If the hotel would just upgrade the coffee a notch, that would be fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: gbuffum
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay at Homewood Suites was excellent. The breakfast/dinner buffet was terrific. Free beer and wine during dinner really topped off the stay in NO. The suites were well maintained with great features (microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator) - really a great place to stay with young children. Hotel manager very courteous, spent time talking to people at dinner buffet to get feedback and to make sure stay was enjoyable. Only downside is no grocery stores close by, but could easily take public transportation or cab if necessary. Walgreens a few blocks away had many items needed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel”
Reviews.Author: CRABBYOLDCODGER
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch establishment with a very friendly staff. I really felt welcome at this hotel. The managers reception offered an excellent break from sightseeing with a nice selection of food. Breakfast was again excellent with friendly and helpful staff. The motel is at an excellent location and parking is close by. Cost is $17 a day. The place is not cheap but if you take advantage of the breakfast and manager's reeception it is more economical. The location is probably not for everyone if you are unable or unwilling to walk six blocks to the French Quarter.I made the walk frequently sometimes with my family and sometimes alone both at night and during the day and never felt unsafe. I actually appreciated the break from the hustle and noise of Bourbon Street but then I am not 20 anymore. We came as a family and this was an excellent place for my finicky teenagers who greatly enjoyed the food, fitness room and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 1Longhorns1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived everyone was too nice. I could not believe how friendly everyone was. We were there for four days. Every single day the staff had smiles on their faces. That was one of the reasons we made reservations there in the first place. We called the hotel directly for reservations and they were just as friendly on the phone. When we arrived I asked for a window facing the front or to the south. The other views did not seem worth having. The front desk clerk said she would take care of it. When we got to the room not only did she take care of my request she also gave us a two bedroom suite with a balcony. It was just me and wife and we only had reserved a one room suite. Very nice. Tuesday evening the manager's reception had roast with potatoes. There was also fresh fruit. Sodas and beer were also available. The roast was very tender. They had a reception Wednesday and Thursday but we ate out so I could not tell you how it was, good I am sure. The hot breakfast was different everyday. Wednesday's breakfast was bacon and eggs and waffles, Thursday's breakfast was sausage and eggs with cinnamon sticks/potatoes. Friday's breakfast was eggs with sausage and pancakes. Saturday's breakfast was eggs and bacon with hash browns. There was also fresh fruit and fresh pastries and cereal everyday in addition to the hot breakfast and orange and apple juice. The room was big and clean. The A/C worked great. It was hot while we were there so that was important. I was worried about the location and our safety because all I heard about post Katrina was the danger of the city. This area was VERY clean, well lit and I felt safe at all times.
