The parking for this hotel is a self serve parking that is not fenced or covered. There is an attendant during the day but I am not sure in the late evenings since we did not use the car at night. We were in New Orleans for a conference. We were a 15min walk away from the convention center. In the mornings it was pleasant to walk. It was a 9min walk to Harrah's. We went to Harrah's at night and felt very safe walking back to the hotel. The street is well lit and well traveled on. The hotel is one block from the St. Charles Railcar. The first two days we took the railcar to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. The last day we were there it was just quicker to walk to Bourbon Street. About an 8min walk. Once again that was well lit and a lot of foot traffic so we felt safe as well. Everything we did while there was within walking distance. I only drove the car twice the entire 4 days we were there. We rode the steamboat on the Mississippi and that was only a 15 min walk from the hotel. By the way, parts of Bourbon street closest to Canal had an unpleasant smell but other than that the French Quarter was clean, well lit and safe. I never felt I was in danger even close to midnite.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice.”
Reviews.Author: BevoLives
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet. Rather average service and amenities. Somewhat out of the way, but good access to taxi's and the St. Charles trolley. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites based on TripAdvisor reviews, and were not disappointed. Check-in was smooth and fast, and our room was big, clean, comfortable and well-appointed. Having a fridge was really convenient, as was the free internet. The breakfast was better than the average hotel continental breakfast, too-- excellent variety that included both healthy and not-so-healthy choices. The hotel is easy walking distance from the streetcar lines and the French Quarter. The only possible negative (and it's a minor one) is that there aren't a lot of restaurants within a block or two, unless you want to go to a restaurant in another one of the hotels along Poydras, but that's not a big deal-- you probably want to go into the French Quarter to eat, anyway! We'd definitely stay here again. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy Suite”
Reviews.Author: wsflyer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Homewood Suites in New Orleans. The location is good, five or so long blocks to the Casino and Aquarium, and 3 or 4 shorter blocks to the French Quarter. Also, a good location to walk to the Superdome or Arena. Our 1-bedroom suite consisted of a bedroom with 2 roomy queen beds, a bathroom (with sink outside the toilet/shower room), and a combination den/kitchen. The morning breakfast was fine--eggs and either sausage, bacon, or some odd pork product (Canadian bacon, maybe?), plus fruit, waffles, cereal, coffee cake. A good start to the day. The evening meals were nothing to write home about, but were certainly edible, and saved us a lot of money. We ate lunches out with our kids, and ate breakfast and dinner (M-Th) at the hotel. The reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars is that there was an odd knocking noise coming from within the walls of our bathroom. The maintenance man heard it, but could do nothing to remedy the situation. It was a loud noise that occurred most often in the middle of the night. Also, be aware the this hotel does not provide hair conditioner. We asked for some, and were promised some, but were later told that there is none available. Anyhow, it was a good stay, and a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Very Clean & ROOMY”
Reviews.Author: jeremyprimo
Reviews.Content: The room was very Big and Clean we had a large group ,and never felt crowded.There is also one of the Best SUSHI BARS in the U.S. right across the street.You cant go wrong Booking this hotel!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: byronstreet
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 nights. Clean and roomy. A true suite in a town of "suites" that do not have doors between the sleeping/living quarters. Breakfast OK. Didn't try the managers dinner because it is New Orleans and we ate out, but it too looked OK. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: antrec
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved this hotel. The hotel room we stayed in had enough room for 3 people. It was not far from the French Quarter but it was close to other attractions. I would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for the Mardi Gras Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Minnie25
Reviews.Content: When we decided to head to New Orleans for the Mardi Gras Marathon, we needed to find a place to stay with a king sized bed and another bed, plus close to the race. The Homewood Suites was just perfect, even better than the Race Headquarters hotel where the Expo was held. This hotel is centrally located, an easy walk to the French Quarter, even easier walk to the Superdome (marathon start and finish), and easy walk to the Aquarium and Riverwalk. The room was very nice, nicer than the other Homewood Suites we have stayed in. Excellent breakfast (we weren't there for the Manager Evening Meals - Mon through Thur only) with hot choices (the bacon was EXCELLENT), fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereal. Alas, no beignets, but it wasn't that far to walk to Cafe Du Monde. The morning of the race, they provided breakfast for all the runners to take with them to the race or to take to their room to eat after the race - bottle of water, juice, fruit, breakfast bars. A very nice thing for them to do. The room was very quiet at night. Check out time was 11AM, but many of the runners, including our group was able to extend that to 1PM without extra cost. Most of their guests arrive for Monday, so they need a bit of extra time to get all the rooms ready. But they were very considerate of the runners. The race goes right past the hotel, so we were able to walk to the start to see our runners take off, then go back to the hotel to see them come back from the French Quarter before the Garden District and then back to the finish line for the half and before they started the second half of the course for the full marathon. Staff was friendly. They offered self parking in a lot next door ($18.02 a night, which wasn't really too bad for NOLA). I was a little worried about the car, but we didn't have any problems. We'd go back there again. Especially since it was just a short walk from the hotel to Mothers (we ate two dinner meals there - great Crawfish Etouffee and fried shrimp). The pool was indoor and not too bad, just a bit warm. And lots of chlorine.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: We play tourist in our home town all the time ,we love New Orleans and we love Homewood suites.We stayed one night for the Van Halen concert.We haved stayed in just about every hotel in New Orleans and I must say we love this Homewood hotel the best.This hotel even beats the hotel which is ranked one of the top in the U.S.A.,without naming names.The main reason is amenities.The rooms have a bedroom,living room,equipped kitchen.Our room also had a balcony.The hotel also has an indoor pool with a hot tub,and a workout room and I must mention the free hot breakfast with eggs, grits ,bacon ,etc .Now which hotel can beat all of this? It is very close to the Superdome and the Arena and within walking distance or a cheap cab ride to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Crowd Pleaser”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Came down to New Orleans for a weekend bachelor party with a bunch of other guys. Have never stayed in a Homewood Suites before, but have stayed in a Residence Inn, so had some idea of what the experience would be like. This is a Residence Inn copycat and actually pretty similar to an Embassy Suites, except that the lobby is smaller and has no atrium, however the in-room kitchen is larger. All in all, it was a great stay. The suites were a great size, perfect for sleeping four people and the bathrooms were large as well. Hotel's location on Poydras is useful to getting to the casino as well as the Quarter and the free morning breakfast, while still heavy on empty carbs, did have some fruit and other choices. Also, the hotel's in-door pool and hot tub were a nice touch. Service was wonderful, very friendly staff who also kept the place in spotless condition. The housekeepers did a good job too. A few items however.... On the weekends, its ridiculous to close breakfast at 10am. Let people sleep in and keep the breakfast open for at least another hour, what the big deal? Also, the decor of the rooms, while new, is nauseating. The couch is purplish brown, the wallpaper in the bathroom is like puke green and grey, reminiscient of a hospital waiting room or nursing home. Just awful. Also, someone pulled the fire alarm at 5am on Sunday morning and we all had to evacuate the hotel, which as unpleasant at this sounds, actually wasnt as bad as Id thought it would be. You're basically sleep-walking anyway and after about 10 mins your back in bed and back to sleep in 30 seconds. I think we got one of the rooms comped that night for the inconvience, actually. Would I come back? Probably not, want something a little sexier or at least something with a more local touch, but the hotel served its purpose for our weekend flawlessly and will continue its real mission of providing rewards points to plenty of satisfied in-and-out biz travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Best in NO”
Reviews.Author: Fouke1
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in NO if you want a nice, family-friendly hotel within walking distance of all of the city's major attractions. The rooms are very clean and spacious and the breakfast is delicious as some of the restaraunts' in the area. Very nice staff and top-notch service. The indoor pool and hot tub was probably the best part.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family or Long Stay Professional Hotel in CBD”
Reviews.Author: LA_Biz_Guy
Reviews.Content: One of the nicer and better run Homewood Suites, it is a very good location for those doing either the Super Bowl or the Convention centre but somewhat of a walk to the Quarters. Big rooms with separate kitchen/sitting room with pullout bed. Free internet that works well and a better-than-average free breakfast. Management is personal and attentive. Pool is large enough for some lap work and the fitness room is adequate. Recommended for long-stay professional working CBD or for a family looking for a strong bargain while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: ht08
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks during October 2007. People are awesome, very helpful in every way possible. Breakfast and Snack in the evening was great. Free internet access, printer, fax etc. Ideal for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: burchard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites before a cruise a couple of weeks ago. There were six of us in a two bedroom suite. We found the hotel to be in a great location - walking distance or a short cab to the French Quarter but NOT in the crazy French Quarter! Neighborhood does get a little iffy if you walk a few blocks the other way though. In general the accommodations were wonderful. The hotel was clean, the suite was nice and the breakfast was good. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for families”
Reviews.Author: Lee4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my husband and 15 month old son. We specifically chose it because it has a true suite set up--bedroom is seperate from the living/kitchen area. Their price on their website was good (internet rate) and we could earn Hilton honors points as well. The hotel is very nice--pretty lobby area and breakfast area as well (there's an indoor pool as well). They had our room ready when we checked in 3 hours early, so that was very nice! They also made a point to tell us we could call and ask for a later check out time the following day, if needed. The room had a kitchen/living area with doors leading to the bedroom and bathroom area. We had 2 queen beds and the hotel provided a pack-n-play for our son. The queen beds and pillows were comfortable, and the room was very clean. I found the hotel to be very quiet--we never heard anything from other rooms. It was really great to have doors seperating the bedroom from the living room. That enabled us to stay up later than our son's early bedtime. There were TVs in both the living room and the bedroom. The kitchen had a microwave, refrigerator, toaster, dishwasher, stove, plates, glasses, utensils, and some pots for cooking. It was a really nice set up and they even provided dishwashing cleaner. The frig also had an ice maker. There was a table/desk with 2 chairs, a couch, club chair with ottoman, and coffee table in the living area. I believe the sofa pulled out into a bed as well. The bathroom had the tub/shower and toilet in the back of the room with a door, then the sink and a closet were outside of this. There was no door to seperate the sink area from the beds. This was a great place to go with a small child and allow us all to have some room to spread out. The hotel is in the Central Business District, so it's not in the main tourist area. We did not try walking to the French Quarter since it rained during our stay. Parking can be a pain. You must pay $17.00 to park and the lot is across the street and down the block a bit from the hotel. It gets full quickly and has parking lifts that allow cars to be raised up if the lot fills so that more cars can park underneath. We were there on a Sunday evening, so there was no one attending the lot that evening. It was very difficult to park our small SUV in the lift things and we were very frustrated. Luckily, an attendent for the parking lot company rode by on his bike and took us a few blocks over to park in in the Holiday Inn's lot--which was fenced and had a full time attendent. I felt better about leaving the car there. The hotel staff did not offer information about the parking situation to us at check-in, so my husband had to go back and forth to the lot to put a sticker on the car since no attendent was there when he first parked. Kind of pain in the rain! Overall, I think this was an excellent hotel for families and would be happy to stay there again--clean and spacious rooms are not always the norm in New Orleans. If you want to be in the heart of the tourist area, this is not the place. If you're willing to walk, drive, or take public transportation to the main tourist areas, this hotel would work well for you.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Mavesgolf
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites is a great place to stay while visiting New Orleans. The guest rooms are large and well equiped with a full sized refrigerator, microwave and even a dishwasher to wash the dishes supplied in the room. The breakfasts are huge with a lot of choices and the nightime food is great as well. If you were on a budget, you could eat breakfast and dinner at the hotel and find something small for lunch. They also have beer and wine during the week. The lobby and pool area are large and clean. Everyone on the staff who I personally talked to was very friendly, and management seems to be around during meal times making sure everything is ok. The location is great- a very easy walk to the French Quarter and Bourbon St. If I ever go back to NO, I'd stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lntrullin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week, and we couldn't have asked for a better location -- the hotel is within spittin' distance of the Superdome, the French Quarter, downtown, and about a 10-15 minute trolley ride away from the Garden District. Since there were three of us on this trip, it was really nice to have a separate common area, so that some uf us could stay up late without disturbing someone sleeping. They also have free breakfasts and a light snack in the afternoon, which is nice if you're not really looking for a full-fledged meal. Our only complaint is the pricey valet parking -- $26 when we were there -- but, trust me, I guess the money is worth it rather than trying to snag a parking spot on your own.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Mardi Gras Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: KateDen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites for two night before our cruise. There were five of us in a two bedroom suite and we had plenty of room for everyone. The only drawback was that neither bathroom opened to the spacious living area, so the person on the sofabed had to walk through a bedroom to get to a bathroom. This was a minor inconvenience, though. We were there during the early Mardi Gras season and were pleased to find that the hotel only two blocks from the St. Charles Street parade route used by most parades. The walk to the French quarter was a bit further --- about 10 minutes. The town is fairly flat, so walking was a pleasure. However, if you need a taxi during Mardi Gras, the proximity to the parade route can cause problems since you have to take a circuitous route (meaning more cost) if there is a parade. And there are two to three parades a day. There weren't many restaurants in the immediate area, but we had planned to dine in the French Quarter anyway, so we weren't really looking at the options around us. Breakfast was plentiful and the selection was good with bacon, sausage, an egg dish, cereals (hot and cold), fruits and breads. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, especially when my father-on-law left his passport somewhere in the room. It was finally found where he had hidden it in the kitchen and we thank the staff for their patience and help with this. We were all able to cruise as scheduled. Great hotel, great price and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for big week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last year, made reservations for a group to stay during 2006 Jazz Fest. Then Katrina hit. Once we heard that the festival was still on we checked on the status of the hotel. At the beginning of the year, we were told that they were already back up and running. The place was very nice. The only thing that still looked like it was being worked on was the pool area (paint on walls). Very friendly staff that made us feel at home. We upgraded to a suite (2 bedrooms, 2 bath, kitchenette, pull out couch). Every morning was a full breakfast (not just donuts and coffee). The evenings also had a manager's reception from 5-7. Variety of dishes, desserts, and drinks (non-alcoholic as well as alcoholic). Tried it two of the nights there. One was really great while the other was not that good. But still nice to relax after touring the city with a glass of wine in front of their big flat panel TV. Everynight before hitting the nightlife, we hit the pool and hot tub. Inside on the ground floor it was very nice especially since we were the only ones down there at the time. Be carefull of the hottub before jumping in. It sure seemed really HOT at times. A basic workout room on the second floor (a couple pieces of equiptment but enought for an ok workout). Free use of the business center with computer/internet use. In the end, a great place to stay. If we return next year for the fest, this will be the place to stay. Now for the bad news. Because of Katrina, the hotel is mostly full of people who are staying there while working (getting new and old businesses back up and running). Because of this, their website does tell you that unless you plan on staying 30 days or longer, you probably will not beable to make reservations. We were lucky since we booked before the storm hit and that they still honored our reservations. So just keep checking back. An email address is also given to get more information regarding this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: SudsnFoamTraveler
Reviews.Content: We came to New Orleans for Jazz Fest stayed at Homewood Suites on poydras. The location was 4 or 5 blocks from anywhere you would want to go. We upgraded to a king suite it had two bedrooms & two bathrooms. Plenty of room for the 5 of us. The staff was very friendly & courtious. The morning breakfast was great & always stocked well. The managers reception was a surprise, more like a meal then a light snack. The pool & hot tub came in very handy after a long day at Jazz Fest. I would definetly stay here again. First time in New Orleans & thought the city was well on it's way back. Some things hindered by lack of employees , but nothing a little patience couldn't handle. Wonderful hotel, great food, lovely city & people

Reviews.Title: “A great Stay”
Reviews.Author: booler
Reviews.Content: I just want to say my Wife and I stayed here for a week and it was great. From the front desk personnel to the housekeeping staff everyone was very polite and attentive. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay for it's friendliness and convenience to the best of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay -”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful holiday in New Orleans in the spring of 2005. We stayed at the Homewood Suites and found the rooms were large and wonderful. I really felt spoiled by your hotel. Next time, I will just stay at this hotel and do all my visiting on foot to the French Quarter. You never felt it was dangerous at all to venture from this location. We did not rent a car and felt it was easy access to the French Quarters and all the special places to visit in the area. We only rented a car to visit the swamp tours and the plantations. We saw Oak Alley Plantation , Laura Plantation and the Honey Swamp Tour. Spring is a great time to visit since there was no humidity and the weather was great. Also crawfish season was the best and we loved the food. The seafood boil with crawdaddies, shrimps, mussels,potatoes,corn,etc was awesome! We saw Mardi Gras World, the French Market, took the St Charles streetcar and rode the whole route and did the Cemetary tour. We tried the Muffalatas, the poboys, the gumbos, and the best seafood. The cafe and beignets were sooooo good and ate those for 3 days for breakfast. We'd love to come back again someday and definitely stay at the homewood suites again. Thanks for a wonderful holiday!We fell in love with your wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family group of 18 stayed for a week at the Hilton Homewood Suites in downtown New Orleans. It is the perfect accommodation for this type of vacation. The suites are large, the facilities complete and excellent, the Staff professional, friendly and accommodating in every way. Homewood's meal program can be a huge saving - especially if you have teenage eating machines. Breakfast is substantial with many hot and cold choices. The weeknight dinner was a real bonus as it is more than adequate and allowed us to make lunch the day's big meal since every New Orleans restaurant serves lunch - and at better prices than dinner. The location is very central to many attractions but it is a 15-20 minute walk to most of them including the French Quarter. Homewood is an absolute A Plus for a New Orleans family vacation. The Greenfield Family Miami, Florida June 2005

Reviews.Title: “Fine Choice”
Reviews.Author: Pattyjo98
Reviews.Content: It is sad to see such a lovely room already getting shabby...all the furniture had stains and the carpet was unravelling in spots and no one had bothered to cut the long strings. Our tub drained poorly and the toilet ran, both repairable. Having said all this, we still love Homewood Suites and have stayed in many of them, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Nice Rooms, Great Service: It's All Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites New Orleans earlier this month as part on an informal family reunion with my aunt, sister, and brother-in-law. It was down to me to select the hotel as I do much more traveling than they do. Based on the reviews here at Trip Advisor I decided this hotel would be to everyone's liking. We were not disappointed. Between us we stayed in two one-bedroom suites and were impressed with how large the suites were. There was plenty of space to spread out and the rooms were immaculate. The kitchen area is fully stocked with flatware, dishes, and cookware if you want to cook your own meals; there is also a large refrigerator (which you will need to store all the leftovers you bring back from the restaurants--there is no such thing as small portions in N.O.), a microwave, and the automatic dishwasher was a nice surprise. The amenities were outstanding as well. The complimentary meals were delicious and there was always a good selection. Coffee and tea service is available 24 hours. I didn't use the pool, but I did take a quick peek and it was a nice sized pool. Also on the premises is a gym, business center, and coin-operated laundry room, all open 24 hours a day. Adjacent to the front desk is a mini convenience store, but prices there are a bit steep as you would expect ($2.25 for a small bottle of apple juice). I would suggest instead going to Walgreens at the corner of Barone and Canal, a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I can't say enough good things about the staff. They were all so friendly and helpful and went above and beyond for us several times. The Homewood Suites is centrally located, with many of the major landmarks (Superdome, French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Harrah's Casino, Riverwalk) no more than a 10 minute walk away. I have just one complaint, and it's a nitpicky one at that. Our balconies did not have chairs, so we were not able to just lounge and get some fresh air. I hope this problem will be corrected in the future. I highly recommend the Homewood Suites New Orleans and will stay there when I visit N.O. in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: ElCert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Homewood Suites by Hilton for 3 nights in May and loved it. This is one I would definitely recommend, and return to if I go back. It is very centrally located in the Central Business District, only a few blocks from the French Quarter. This hotel delivers much more for your money than most suite hotels. The 2 room suites are very spacious, clean and excellent for families. I really appreciated having a full sized refrigerator and space to stretch out. They offer a free happy hour/light supper every weeknight from Sun - Thurs. with drinks (you pour your own beer, wine or soda) and snacks as well as a featured hot entree that differs each night. Breakfast buffet was abundant and had many choices, including hot dishes (scrambled eggs and sausage). You can also make your own waffles if you want. It did get quite crowded, so on one day there was no seating to be found, and the wait for the 2 elevators was very long. Overall, I was very impressed with the generosity, quality and value of all the amenities. I've stayed in Embassy Suites before and in my opinion they pale in comparison to this hotel. The staff were very efficient and friendly; the doorman was a real wonderful gentleman. We never had to use the valet, as we were able to find free after hours & weekend street parking next to the hotel. There is a small gym and a medium sized pool which is indoors; this surprised me somewhat considering how hot it is there in the summer. Overall, I give two enthusiastic thumbs up to Homewood Suites. It exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: FootballTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was about my 15th visit to New Orleans and I have had an oppoutunity to visit several haotels in the city. Prior to this visit the W had been my favorite. I must say that this is my favorite and for the price it can't be beat. The rooms are clean, spacious and very comfortable. The breakfast was very good as well. I will definitely say that the concierge Judy Clymens is great. This was my wife's first visit to New Orleans and she is ready to return already, one of the main reasons is because of Judy.

Reviews.Title: “Super - Duper - Plushy Bed!!”
Reviews.Author: labgalbuffalo
Reviews.Content: We searched lots of New Oleans hotel web sites, and read lots of reviews on 'Trip Advisor' before my husband and I decided on The Homewood suites. I'm so glad we did. We stayed for 6 nights, starting on the last weekend of the N.O. Jazz and Heritage festival, and the hotel was my favorite part of the stay. Homewood Suites needs to work on their website to promote the fact that they have Big & Thick - Comfy Beds! I've stayed at hotels with the "Sweet Sleeper Beds", and at expensive hotels with crappy beds (Like in Vegas), and wouldn't go back. After walking all day and doing touristy things, there is nothing like being comfortable. The indoor pool was great, and the hot tub was even better. I agree with the other reviews, that the breakfast buffet was fantastic, however, when the hotel says it ends at 9:30am, they are not kidding. The very efficient staff stops replenishing at 9:20am, and is clearing the leftovers away by 9:30am. That was a little extreme. I did appreciate the fact that they didn't say anything when I would make up a plate to take to my husband in the room. I was usually up earlier, to eat breakfast and swim, so I would take him breakfast up to the room. With the fridge, microwave and toaster in the room; it was the best of both worlds. We were told by some guests we met at the pool, that they had a few things stolen from their room. That kind of publicity is going to hurt the hotel. Just to be safe, we asked house keeping not to make up the room when we were out, and just asked for more towels and TP in the evening. They even offered to lock up our laptop in the managers office, since their safe deposit boxes were so small. The staff was extremely agreeable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Homewood Suites. It's a beautiful property, and the price was quite reasonable compared to others in the area. The continental breakfast offering was very good. We loved it for the first two days. Unfortunatley, however, on the third day we took a road trip to the beach in Mississippi and were gone from very early until very late. We returned to one very nice surprise -- a complimentary bottle of champagne provided for my friend's birthday -- and one not so nice surprise. A bag full of souvenirs that had been left in the room was missing. Maybe it's my own fault for not making sure it was locked up, but there wasn't anything there that was really of any great material value... mostly just sentimental reminders of the trip. We managed to replace some of the items, which meant buying them all a second time, but there were a couple of places we weren't able to return to in the time we had left. One of those was the swamp we toured where I had purchased my most treasured shirt of the trip which I never even got to wear! The incident was reported to the Homewood Suites staff, but they were less than helpful. Everyone was very friendly and appeared genuinely concerned, but nothing ever actually got done. The manager kept assuring us that he was looking into it and was going to contact the housekeeper who had been in charge of our room that day but we left more than one person at the desk with cell phone numbers where we could be contacted and never received a single call from them and at the time we checked out, they still had not spokent to the housekeeper. At this point, I am trying to get a response from someone higher up in the company. There are notices in the room stating that, per Louisiana state law, the hotel is not to be held responsible for missing items, but there was also a card that stated that your night's stay is free if you are not 100% satisfied, and I certainly wasn't. It really disappoints me that I am not able to give this hotel a great review because it really is a nice place but this incident put a damper on our whole trip and as such I can't say I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Homewood Suites, and it was wonderful. The rooms were clean, spacious, and the beds were comfortable. The location is convenient, and yet away from the noise of the Quarter. The breakfast offering was convenient, and well-attended by the staff. Our experience was made especially terrific by the service we received. From check-in through the entire stay, the staff was gracious and extremely helpful. We've stayed in several places in New Orleans and this is hands-down the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: calinurse
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a 2 bedroom suite. It was huge. All aspects of the hotel were great: lovely decor, high-standard housekeeping, front desk staff, the great doorman who we saw on weekend mornings--an older gentleman who is the epitome of southerm hospitality. We accidentally left clothes in a drawer and the staff, from Ben the general manager to Jamilla the chief housekeeper, were so helpful. We had no problems with check-in. The location is central and very good. No way would I want to stay right in the French quarter. It was a releif to get back to the quietness of this hotel. From the hotel, it's about a three block walk to the Canal Street edge of the French quarter. If you're heading to the Garden district/St Charles Ave, it's two blocks to get on the streetcar at the corner of Poydras and St Charles. It's a ten minute walk to the Sports Arena and the adjacent small shopping mall (Macy's etc). Breakfast filled us up. The evening light supper was a nice touch, with a small salad. Hot beverages are available at all times. I'd recommend this hotel especilly for families. Thank you, Homewood Suites New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Homewood Suites in New Orleans. What a great hotel! Our room was clean and ready before check in!. The breakfast was great and always hot and fresh. Our hotel was great, not much to say regarding New Orleans. Was not the cleanest city to tour, alittle on the "seedy" side. Would not recommend the city to a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: tjseadoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Homewood Suites property four nights, March 31-April 4. The rooms were very large and clean. The one bedroom suite was as large as 2 hotel rooms. We were very surprised to find a kitchen efficiency complete with refridge and microwave. The pool is very nice. Indoors, with a very warm jacuzzi. Perfect way to work out those muscles tired from all that walking. The public areas were upscale and clean. The meal area was comfortable and there was plenty of seating each time we visited. We never actually ate much at any meal. There is too much great food to be had throughout the city! Just juice each morning. One review says that the"dinner offering was deplorable." What is anybody doing in New Orleans eating a free hotel buffet? One of the main reasons to be in New Orleans is the food!!! Overall, it was a great hotel. The only problem we had was upon checkin. We had to wait until 5 pm to checkin. We werent the only ones. Every day as we walked past the front desk, somebody was complaining about their checkin, ie not having a room ready, not getting their requested n/s room or not having any rooms ready at all (our problem). The streetcar stop is only 2-3 blocks away, so getting either uptown or downtown(only 5 blocks to canal)was no problem. If I were there longer than 4 days, I would stay closer to canal as the walk from the quarter after a full day or night sightseeing was difficult sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jakuch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Homewood Suites property four nights, March 28-April 1. The rooms were spacious, well decorated and clean. The towels were almost new and of good quality and the shower had good pressure. The staff was very helpful. Once there were no towels at the pool -- after calling, staff brought them in 5 minutes. The pool area itself is very nice. Indoors, nice, Italian-style slate tile and a good spa. The public areas were upscale and clean. The meal area was comfortable and there was plenty of seating each time we visited. The breakfast was okay. Eggs, sausage, cereals, and the waffle machine. Staff replenished supplies often. The dinner offering was deplorable. We have stayed at many Homewood Suites and enjoy the M-Th. light dinner. We expect them to be basic but offering good, fresh, food. As we had four nights to sample the dinner offerings, we know there was not just an "off" night. The salad was all iceberg (which is okay..) but had brown edges each night. On "Mexican" night there was no salsa, no sour cream, no chips. There were very strange, soggy, corn torillas -- one rolled around bland meat mush, and the other, bright orange "C" grade cheesefood. Very strange. For my money, the Homewood suites in downtown Chicago has the best dinner offering. The drink offerings were fine -- a drinkable red/white wine in bottles each night. The beer was Bud Lite and one night Abita (yea!). Overall, it was a lovely hotel and we enjoyed catching the streetcars the stop closeby. If the food service manager could upgrade the dinner presentation it would make it a top notch Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “homewood suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we made our reservations back in nov for a stay in march. there was a group of us that booked rooms together, three for 2 nights and 1 double suite for 1 night. we did ask for rooms up higher as we had older children that would enjoy the view. upon arrival, we were told our rooms were not ready. we were told if we wanted to wait, we could get rooms together. after waiting 2 hours, watching others check in, we were given 2 of the 3 rooms on 2 separate floors, 4th and 5th respectively, as there were no rooms available the 6th through the 12th floor. finally, we declined the 3rd room after waiting so long (one of the rooms was a double room suite). the next day the next group checked in-the people at the desk knew they were with us-this broup was given a double room suite on the 11th floor! again, we had made these reservations months in advance as a group. there was a apathetic response on the part of the front desk. on the other hand, the conceriges were fantastic, especially byron. He was very helpful in assisting our group with good excursions-the walking ghost stories (which the children loved) and an excellent restaurant. the breakfast was good, the pool very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: Slamar
Reviews.Content: My mother, 2 children, their Godmother, and I stayed at the Homewood Suites in the Central Business District in New Orleans the night before our cruise and for 2 days after. The location was very central to everything - close to the port of New Orleans, Superdome, French Quarter, St. Charles Trolley, Children's Museum, and Casino. Given the size of our party and the availability, we were upgraded to a 2 BR suite on both stays - this was great as their were 2 bathrooms, 2 BR, and a pull out sofa - plenty of room for 5 people. The mini kitchen with the full refrigerator was great for kids. And the breakfast was decent (although this one did not have the waffle makers to make your own waffles). The bellman at the hotel was outstanding - he was very knowledgable about the city and his recommendations were all accurate. The concierge was also outstanding - her dining suggestions were great!! She was very patient with children and simply a pleasure to talk to. Although we did not use the indoor pool, it looked very nice - clean. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who likes extra room to move in as opposed to a small closet with a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious rooms/Great Location/Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites over the March 4th, 2005 weekend. We have two kids. The rooms were spotless. I am a little O.C.D. about cleaning the hotel room when I check in---but even my Lysol wipes couldn't detect any dirt!! The breakfast in the lobby was very good. The location is near the French Quarter and The Aquarium. It is a great choice for families who don't won't to spend big $$$'s and don't want to get two rooms for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “I picked a good one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read about Homewood Suites at Trip Advisor.com and booked a two day stay before taking a cruise. We were two couples and reserved a two bedroom suite. It was great. What more can I say.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites--Great deal and location!”
Reviews.Author: dckiddo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Homewood Suites for New Year's Eve and the Sugar Bowl... Hokies fans :) The hotel location was fantastic! An easy walk to the French Quarter, River Walk, and Super Dome. We rented a car for our stay, but found walking so easy that once we arrived, we never took the car out. Next visit we may just hire a cab ($28 each way from the airport as opposed to paying the $23 per night for parking a car we didn't use). The staff at Homewood Suites were wonderful. Don't miss out on the manager's evening hospitality buffet in the lobby Monday-Thursday. We had thought it would be light refreshments and were amazed to find a complete dinner buffet including free beer, wine and soft drinks. When you factor in a full breakfast buffet and dinner -- this hotel is a steal! The suite was beautiful, clean and spacious. The living area and kitchenette were well-appointed. With the mild weather, we enjoyed having a balcony... Without a doubt, when we return to New Orleans, we'll be staying at Homewood Suites!

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites New Orleans
HotelInfo.Address: 901 Poydras St, New Orleans, LA 70112
